result.execSummary:
The defendant Donte T Paskel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during probation imposed in Count 2. Failure to do so will result in entry of a civil judgment.
48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crimes of domestic violence.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample; pay costs and DNA surcharge. Pay all mandatory costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

- No contact with firearms. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
- Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/ Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
- Parenting classes.
- Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
- NO CONTACT with the victims, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
- 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.

timeConds.notes: STAYED; pending a review on 04-08-16 at 1:15pm Br-38

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Donte T Paskel

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order Denying Motion for Reconsideration of No Contact Order, signed, filed and distributed. LNR
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. spc

Defendant's pro se motion for reconsideration of the no contact order.  

(return address: Donte Paskel #583715, Green Bay Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 19033, Green Bay, WI  54307-9033)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING (13 pages) commencing SEPTEMBER 25, 2015 received and filed.
Per email from Probation Dept., defendant's probation has been or is in the process of being revoked.  4-08-2016 review hearing is cancelled.

Defendant Donte T Paskel in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Donte T Paskel in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by counsels and the defendant.
AS to count 1:   The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, with credit for 92 days time served.  Court orders the payment of all costs, assessments and surcharges to be paid during probation imposed in count 2 and failure to do so will result in entry of civil judgment.
AS to count 2:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 0 days time served, consecutive to count 1.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 30 MONTHS.  
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 90 days in the House of Correction STAYED pending a review on 4-8-2016 at 1:15pm in Branch 38.
-Attend and successfully complete Batterers Intervention OR Anger Management and continued programming.
-Mental health evaluation and take all prescribed medication(s), and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-AODA and recommended treatment including random urine screens/Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-Parenting classes.
-Attend and successfully complete treatment and counseling programs as deemed appropriate by agent.
-NO CONTACT with the victims, UNLESS requested by victim and then only with prior approval of agent or the court.
-3rd party contact for the purpose of time with child(ren) as approved by agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-NO NEW LAW VIOLATIONS.
-Pay all MANDATORY costs, assessments, surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by Dept of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. ANY CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED.
-Provide DNA sample, pay costs and DNA surcharge.
-48 USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
RECEIVED & FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Court ordered the defendant remanded pending sentencing.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.

Defendant Donte T Paskel in court with attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Donte T Paskel in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 1:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

As to Count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

As to Counts 3 and 4:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered Counts 3 and 4 dismissed and read-in to the case for the purposes of sentencing.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Joel Alan Mogren in court, defendant Donte T Paskel not in court, in custody.  Attorney Torbenson appeared on behalf of Abbey Marie DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests a Plea Hearing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 38.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 08-12-2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Donte T Paskel in court with Attorney Joel Alan Mogren.  Defendant Donte T Paskel in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson, appearing for Abbey DeSiato, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Milwaukee Police Dept. Detective Ronald Linzmeyer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  
Defense counsel requests adjournment for scheduling.  Court orders case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 4.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
Clerk:  jms

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MESHAWNA M., ALEXUS E., KM (01/26/15).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Donte T Paskel in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Donte T Paskel in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant plead not guilty TO MISDEMEANOR COUNTS 1, 3, AND 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
